p: A phylogenetic analysis carried out by Pastore et al. (2011), using molecular data, pointed out the need for modifications in the classification of the taxon. Based on this study, 12 new genera were recognized, augmenting the subtribe to 19 genera ( Harley and Pastore, 2012). Consequently, Hyptidinae comprises the genus Hyptis with approximately 144 species, the genera Eriope, Condea, Cantinoa, Mesosphaerum, Cyanocephalus and Hypenia, with 20–30 species and the genera Hyptidendron and Oocephalus, including about 20 species, each one. The other genera have less than 10 species: Medusantha (eight species), Gymneia (six species), Marsypianthes (five species), Leptohyptis (five species), Martianthus (four species), Asterohyptis and Eplingiella (3–4 species) and Physominthe, with two species. Finally, the subtribe includes the monotypic genera Eriopidion and Rhaphiodon ( Harley and Pastore, 2012) . This is the Lamiaceae clade with the largest number of species in Brazil ( Harley, 2012; Harley and Pastore, 2012), presenting high rates of endemism ( Harley, 2014).
